newsitem.title: USA: Qantas decides against Interactive Flight system.
newsitem.headline: Qantas decides against Interactive Flight system.

text.p: Interactive Flight Technologies Inc said Tuesday Qantas Airways has decided not to install a new interactive in-flight entertainment system for its long haul fleet.
Instead, Qantas decided to keep its existing in-flight system for the time being, Interactive Flight said.
Interactive Flight Technologies had previously been selected to possibly supply a new interactive in-flight entertainment system. The value of the potential contract was not disclosed.

"While we are obviously disappointed that Qantas has decided not to equip its long haul fleet with our state-of-the-art interactive in-flight entertainment system, we continue to believe that our interactive in-flight network is the wave of the future in providing entertainment to airline passengers," said Michail Itkis, chief executive officer of Interactive Flight Technologies.
Shares of Interactive Flight lost 1-10/16 to 4-1/8.
